content: hooded cowl materials  worsted weight yarn approximately 300-350 g 600-700 m o i used red heart super saver  6 mm crochet hook or size needed for gauge  stitch markers optional gauge cowl 80 st x 20 row = 10 w x 8 h hood 3 = 10 st x 8 row abbreviations  stitch st  front post double_crochet fpdc  chain chain  back post double_crochet bpdc  slip_stitch slip_stitch  herringbone half_double_crochet hhdc  double_crochet double_crochet special stitches  herringbone half_double_crochet hhdc yarn over & insert hook in stitch indicated pul up a loop then pull hook through first loop on hook yarn over & pull through remaining 2 loops on hook chain 80 join with slip_stitch making sure chain does not twist note row 1 to 20 are worked in the round row 1 right side chain 2 does not count as a stitch double_crochet in each chain around 80 st join with slip_stitch to top of first double_crochet 80 st row 2 20 chain 2 does not count as a stitch fpdc in same st bpdc in next st fpdc in next st around 80 st row 21 chain 1 does not count as a stitch hhdc in each stitch around do not join turn row 22-34 chain 1 does not count as a stitch 2 hhdc in first st hhdc in each st around to last st 2 hhdc in last stitch turn row 35-55 chain 1 does not count as a stitch hhdc in each st around turn turn work wrong side out chain 1 join 2 sides of hood with slip_stitch working in front loop of nearest side & back loop of farthest side slip_stitch along length of hood fasten_off & weave in ends how to fold turn right side out fold cowl portion inside hood & pull over head face will be covered by the cowl fold cowl in half so face is no longer covered pull hood up & fold back edges
